intro: Echinella lappiformis, commonly known as the hairy lappwort, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants known for their distinctive leaf structures and often edible or medicinal properties. The plant is characterized by its basal rosette of hairy, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, greenish flowers in late spring. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and rocky slopes. Echinella lappiformis is notable for its ecological role in supporting local insect populations and its potential use in traditional herbal medicine.
